awards: IES Illumination Award of Excellence – IES 2020
1st Prize of Indoor Lighting Design – CIES 2019
1st Prize of Indoor Lighting Design - CIES 2013
1st Prize of Outdoor Lighting Design – CIES 2022
1st Prize of Indoor Lighting Design- CIES 2009
2nd Prize of Outdoor Lighting - CIES Shanghai 2018
2nd  Prize of Indoor Lighting Design – CIES 2022
1st Prize of Indoor Lighting Design - CIES 2017
2nd Prize of Indoor Lighting Design - CIES 2014

1st-buddhist-architectural-lighting-desi.article: From November 16th to 18th, 2018, the “First Buddhist Architectural Lighting Design Forum” was successfully organized by China Illumination Engineering Society (CIES) and professional medium platform “First Design” in Wuxi, Jiangsu. There were 231 participates from 23 cities in China, including architects, interior designers, lighting designers, contractors, system integrators, lighting manufactures, and developers. Richard Wang, general manager and design director of ATL Lighting Design (Shanghai) Company gave a keynote speech on “Exploration of Lighting Design in Buddhist Cultural Buildings” in the forum. Richard shared case studies of ATL’s award-winning Buddhist cultural projects, highlighting the crucial role of lighting design in the integrated expression of Buddhist culture with architecture and environment.

2019-company-outing.article: Company outing is a tradition to get every designer together and unwind in a scenic place spot for a few days. From Sep 9 to Sep 11, 2019, with colleagues from new Xi’an office, ATL team climbed the Mount Tai, a mountain a mountain of historical and cultural significance located in Shandong province, China.

2020-ies-illumination-award-of-excellenc.article: ATL design team was recognized by IES for 2020 IES Illumination Award of Excellence in the lighting design of Confucian Palace. Composed of auditoriums, amenities and five traditional halls, the 65,000-sq palace built to honor Confucius and his disciples required lighting that could provide various scenes to fulfill the functions of each space, while also highlighting elements of the interior design that symbolize Confucius’s influence on Chinese people and culture.

2022-darc-awards-shortlist.article: The Nianhaucang designed by ATL’s outdoor team is nominated in the shortlist of Low Budget Structures – 2022 [d]arc awards, while the Fangxia and Yunshu from indoor team is also in the shortlist of High Budget Places. The [d]arc awards are rooted in the arc and darc magazines with the reputation as being the most widely read and respected lighting design publications in the world. The shortlist has been chosen by an international jury of lighting designers.

2022-iald-award-of-excellence.article:
CHICAGO, IL USA | The global lighting community gathered online for the third time to honor the winners of the 39th Annual International Association of Lighting Designers (IALD) International Lighting Design Awards, presented by Acuity Brands, the longest running and one of the most prestigious lighting design awards programs in existence. Twenty-two projects were on display from eleven countries—including exteriors, interiors, memorials, hospitality, museums, tourism, and places of worship.

The design of the Guanyin Altar in Zhoushan, Zhejiang, China with lighting design by Shanghai ATL Lighting Design Co., Ltd took home an IALD Award of Excellence.

atl-shanghai-new-office.article: ATL Shanghai moved into an iconic building located in the Urban Best Practice Area on June 28, 2020. As a green building showcase, the new office building is the Alsace Pavilion during Expo Shanghai 2010. Equipped with a water curtained solar panel on the south facade, the building effectively utilizes green energy upon the changes of outdoor temperature and sunlight intensity. Inside the building, a Human Centric Lighting system demonstrates the cutting-edge lighting technology to maximize energy saving and achieve the highest standard of Well Building V2.

completion-of-the-confucian-palace.article: Working together with Architects, interior designers, lighting suppliers, and contractors for three years, ATL Lighting Design has completed another masterpiece, Confucian Palace, which is located in the hometown of Confucius, Qufu, Shandong province.

learning-never-stops.article: To pursue the design excellence, ATL continuously cultivates the design team to be a learning organization. In the beginning of every year, ATL sets up the annual learning plan, and the 2019 theme is “Learning Never Stops”. ATL annual learning scheme has been formed with designated subject in a bi-weekly basis. The 1st session was facilitated by technical director Steve Zhang with the topic of “New State Lighting Regulation and the Impact to Design Process” on February 18th, 2019.

led-technology-workshop.article: As one of the leading lighting design companies in China, ATL Lighting Design always takes initiative to adopt cutting-edge lighting technology in new projects, where architecture and lighting perfectly combine together, create significant additional value to customers. On April 19th, Pascal Kang and Cindy He from Samsung LED, and ATL designers conducted a workshop. Samsung LED specialists introduced the latest LED and smart lighting technology and the best LED and smart lighting cases around world. ATL designers shared their lighting design practice in LED and lighting control applications in the workshop.

museum-lighting-workshop.article: As one of the leading lighting design companies in China, ATL Lighting Design always takes initiative to adopt cutting-edge lighting technology in new projects, where architecture and lighting perfectly combine together, create significant additional value to customers. On April 19th, Pascal Kang and Cindy He from Samsung LED, and ATL designers conducted a workshop. Samsung LED specialists introduced the latest LED and smart lighting technology and the best LED and smart lighting cases around world. ATL designers shared their lighting design practice in LED and lighting control applications in the workshop.

new-technology-and-application-workshop.article: ATL is a professional architectural lighting design and consulting company.  As a learning organization, ATL continuously studies, explores and adopts leading-edge technology to create value for customers and the society.  To address the challenge in the most dynamic and fast growing China market, ATL Shanghai and Signify China organized a new technology and application workshop in ATL Shanghai Office on July 19, 2019.

vivid-sydney-2019-field-trip.article: A good lighting design can be the finishing touch of a building. Lighting designers shall consider both psychological and physical needs of human beings. ATL learns from best practice, conducting field trip of world class landmark lighting projects every year. Back from the Vivid Sydney 2019, the biggest festival of lights, music and ideas in the world, Richard shared his observations and reflections from the light arts in Sydney, including Opera House and Sydney Bay Bridge.

confucian-palace.description:
Located in the birthplace of Confucius, Nishan, about 25 kilometers southeast of Qufu, China, the Confucian Palace was built to honor Confucius and his disciples, and to demonstrate Confucianism and related Chinese cultures.

The lighting design covers a 65,000 sqm interior space, composed of traditional halls, auditoriums and amenities. Five functional halls are named after the Five Virtues of Confucianism: the halls of Benevolence, Righteousness, Courtesy, Wisdom and Loyalty. The ancient Chinese-style architectural structures, such as columns, Tou-kung and beams are extensively adopted in the Palace.

The challenge of lighting design is not only to provide various lighting scenes to fulfill multiple functions of each space, but also to highlight Confucius’ profound influence on Chinese people and culture through the interior design of the Palace. The lighting seamlessly integrates with traditional Chinese-style architecture, while adds another unique impressive layer.   

Thousands of customized Chinese traditional LED candlesticks controlled by a DMX521 system flicker throughout the Palace and symbolize “The Light of Confucianism Shines Forever”. Dozens of LED candle pendants are used in the Hall of Benevolence to create the ambience of a traditional Chinese library. Together with a large media screen, each LED candle in the pendants and every LED lighted bookshelf can be synchronized to present a five-minute light show called “The Power of Benevolence”.  

Four distinctive small halls of Righteousness, Courtesy, Wisdom and Loyalty represent four legendary beasts in Chinese culture. Lighting matches interior decoration to create four different color atmospheres for the four halls respectively.  

To comply with energy code, luminaires are equipped with >100lm/w LED modules, and most of them are managed by lighting control systems with energy-saving mode. Meanwhile, customized and concealed luminaries are requested to use replaceable LED modules for both initial and maintenance cost considerations

five-seal-mandala.description:
Located in the Lingshan scenic area, Five Seal Mandala is a Tibetan Buddhist style building serving as an exhibition for Tibetan Buddhist culture.             

After in-depth discussions with interior designers, ATL developed a lighting scheme with 10,000 butter lanterns on all sides to create the atmosphere of a Tibetan Buddhist temple. Butter lanterns are customized from LED light sources, with brightness and twinkle controlled by a DMX512 lighting control system. The effect of flashing lights is similar to traditional butter lamps with glass covers found in many Tibetan Buddhist temples.

Since their grand opening, Five Seal Mandala has hosted many Tibetan Buddhists from all over China. This project won the first prize of lighting design by CIEC in 2013

guanyin-altar.description: As the largest contemporary Buddhist building in the world, the Guanyin Altar facilitates Buddhist cultural exhibition, sightseeing, pilgrimage, and international exchange in a 62,000 sqm space.  Combining modern architectural style, Buddhist and traditional Chinese culture, the unique architecture was reinforced by an innovative lighting design. By means of a lighting system integrating functional lighting and artistic lighting show, visitors are immersed in the spirit of Guanyin, “the light of Buddha shines on all living beings”.  To illustrate the culture of Guanyin, a variety of lighting techniques are used to precisely exhibit Buddhist art works and highlight traditional Chinese architectural elements.

huallywood-studio.description:
Huallywood Studio is a revitalization project based in an abandoned steel plant covering an area of 340,000 square meters. The purpose of this studio is to be an entertainment and cultural commercial complex. The studio includes a main workshop area, as well as a large artificial lake. The Wuxi municipal government planned to maintain the original architectural framework and transform it into a commercial complex for indoor film studios and digital post-production. A film-themed park was developed through renovating the building’s facades, interior design, as well as restructuring the landscape.

The project was planned and designed by GENSLER Company. ATL consulted on the lighting design for covering the building facades, landscape and indoor facilities. ATL integrated LED lighting and an outdoor display facing the main street to highlight a color banner nearly 2 meters high and 1,000 meters long. For the indoor lighting, ATL provided the design for a large workshop, the public shopping mall, and various artworks.

Following the completion of this project, Huallywood has become a prominent center for entertainment in Wuxi city.

huancui-tower.description:
Huancui Tower is located at the top of Huancui Hill Park in Weihai city. It is a new pavilion-style building complex that imitates the Ming Dynasty (AD 1368 – 1644) architectural style. It is a landmark building in Weihai, hosting cultural and artistic exhibitions and functions.  Huancui Tower also displays Chinese calligraphy, paintings and woodcarvings.

The lighting design scope included the main tower, two wing buildings, the entrance steps, surrounding walls and landscape. Working closely with the architect and owner, ATL designers created a lighting plan of hiding LED lighting fixtures in architectural structures and components. The projection lamps illuminating the roof were customized LED fixtures in the shape of the glazed tiles. The fixtures illuminate the tile surface, while the colour-changeable lights at the top are diffusely reflected. The floodlight of the main tower is a 2700K warm color light.

In consultation with interior designers, ATL created a warm and comfortable space with warm white light of 3000K. 2700K decorative LED lighting strips were used throughout for contrast.  

In Weihai, Huancui Tower is a beautiful lookout location. With this lighting effect, Huancui Tower has also become a popular nightscape to visit.

lingshan-buddhist-palace.description:
Lingshan Buddhist Palace is a famous cultural building in Wuxi, China, accommodating tourism, conferences, exhibitions and cultural experiences. The building is 150 meters by 180 meters, with a total construction area of 50,000 square meters.

ATL professional consultants had the privilege of working closely with Hyee Interior Design Company and the owners, Lingshan Group. They adopted the most advanced LED and lighting control technology, DALI & DMX, to optimize the combination of art and technology, carving a masterpiece combining Chinese Buddhist grotto art and traditional Buddhist architectural elements. In the core area of the palace, the super dome of the Altar Hall was illuminated by hundreds of thousands of RGBW LEDs, which created a striking atmosphere.

This outstanding lighting design work won the highest honor in China’s lighting industry, the first prize of CIEC Indoor Lighting Design in 2008.

silk-road-street.description:
The “Silk Road” Street is a large-scale commercial and tourism district in Xi’an city, China. It locates at the historic site – West Market of Chang’an City in Tang dynasty (AD 618 – 907), southwestern part of Xi’an Ancient City Wall. The total planned area of the project is about 33 hectares.

ATL consultants created “comfortable, charming and memorable” as the lighting design theme for “Silk Road” street, a first-class commercial tourism block with exotic cultural characteristics. The India Square is an entrance area for visitors, standing a memorial pavilion with prominent Indian architectural style. The elephant relief on the stairs and the Kumarajiva statue on the square are the most important landscapes. The main purpose of the lighting is to cast the elephant relief and the image of Kumarajiva statue with surface illumination level, while the floodlights highlight the pillars and top cover of the memorial pavilion. Meanwhile, the floodlights in the lower part of the top cover provide a basic safety illumination. The building facades and railings on the square are illuminated by accent lighting, creating a special atmosphere, and a holistic view for visitors in the distance.

thousand-buddha-hall-specchar-usnisa-pal.description:
The five-story Thousand Buddha Hall on the ground floor of the Unisian Palace is the core visiting space. In the center of the Thousand Buddha Hall, there is a sacred pagoda of the Buddha’s skeleton. It is named as the Great Sacrifice Pagoda, which is the largest indoor Chinese-Tibetan world Pagoda in China. It is surrounded by a thousand statues of Bodhisattva and flying apsaras, creating a magnificent “Buddha’s Heavenly Boundary”.

The Lighting design is to address the basic visiting function, and more important, to highlight the core of Unisian Palace, the Great Sacrificed Pagonda, and the thousand Buddha statues. Due to the unique space of the hall, the shape of statues, and the three-story platform of the pagoda, an ultra-narrow beam LED lighting projection system in a long distance is adopted. With the intelligent control function, it creates different levels of space atmosphere by outlining the decorative facade through a variety of lighting scenes setup.

usnisa-palace.description:
Nanjing Niushou Mountain is famous for its origin of Niutou Sect of Chinese Zen Buddhism Culture, which has flourished for more than 1,700 years. Built in 2017, Usnisa Palace locates in the west peak of Niushou Mountain. It is 220 meters long, 160 meters wide and 90 meters high. The single construction area covers about 136,000 square meters.

The inside space of Usnisa Palace consists of 9 floors, with 6 floors underground and 3 floors above ground. The interior designer adopted many traditional Chinese construction techniques. The grotto culture elements in different stages of Buddhist development are selected as the creative materials, forming a Buddhist cultural and artistic space of the unity of heaven and human. The whole Usnisa Palace composes of three core spaces: Zen State Scenery, Great Usnisa Hall and Usnisa Worship Palace. In addition, it includes functions of convention, exhibition, catering and other commerce spaces.

To create different atmospheres of Zen cultures in three core spaces, ATL lighting consultants worked closely with interior designer, adopting and combining different leading-edge lighting technologies, e.g. daylighting, DALI and DMX controls and LED illumination in super large scale. The detailed lighting design solutions are illustrated in each space.

wang-xiaohui-art-museum.description:
Suzhou Wang Xiaohui Art Museum is a four-door old Jiangnan house. It is the Suzhou government that provides “Ding Zhai” to Wang Xiaohui free of charge as an art gallery open to the public. This is an art gallery that promotes contemporary works by Wang Xiaohui and famous artists from home and abroad.

The façade of the building is decorated with stainless steel curtains. During the day, the lines of the building are tough and rigorous. At night, the red facade of the old house in Jiangnan is restored against the light. The Dingzhai building has a deep sense of depth, and the interior and the courtyard form a layered effect. As the main empty space, the exhibition hall takes into account the combination of classical architecture and Wang’s contemporary art, and strives to realize the use of ancient houses. The exhibition hall space uses 0.9m**0.9m light boxes to distribute the entire ceiling. The RGBW lights in the light box are controlled by DMX512. The system realizes dynamic changes, which can not only meet the basic needs of the exhibition halls with bright and uniform space, but also present the works of Wang Xiaohui in a freehand manner on the ceiling; the courtyard has a strong “Suzhou classical garden” feature, in the lighting Adhering to the “quiet, quiet” principle of the garden.

The project opened in September 2013 and received much attention from the media, the art world and the lighting industry. In 2015, it won the second prize in the Lighting Interior Design Award.

zen-state-scenery-specchar-usnisa-palace.description:
To create a large-scale comprehensive tourist space, Zen State Scenery takes the concept of “human landscape” to integrate natural landscape, Buddhist holy land and humanistic landscape.

In the center of the hall, a white marble statue of Sakyamuni is lying on a lotus base. ATL consultants considered two main aspects for the lighting design of Zen landscape, one was to meet the functional lighting for the tourist space, the other was to provide a phenomenal effect for Buddhist rituals and performances. ATL consultants developed a solution, a combination of artificial and natural lighting, a changeable divine sky on the top of the hall. It is a daylighting dome, to provide natural sunshine in sunny days, and meanwhile, energy-saving and long lifetime LED high-power spotlights are used to provide comfortable and safe basic lighting for the space under gloomy days and evening. During performance time, dome luminous film can simulate the morning and dusk in a short time to restore the sky at different times. The LED can change color and color temperature, showing a fresh and bright morning, or to simulate the blue sky and white clouds at noon. In Buddhist ritual moments, it can simulate the scene of Buddha Star Nirvana as well.

DALI control technology is used in the solution, which guarantees the stability of lighting fixtures in large space. It enhances lifetime, implements the monitoring of the operation status and reduces the maintenance cost. The lighting management system combines centralized master control with scene and timing control. It is integrated with stage and sound management system to create a real “Human Landscape”.

bacheng-town.description: Bacheng Town, located in Kunshan City, Jiangsu Province, is the home of the famous Kun Opera. The Old Street in Bacheng, which was built in the Qing Dynasty, not only connects many landmark buildings in the ancient town, but also captures the inheritance and development of Kun Opera. The landscape lighting design and implementation of the Old Street not only restores the history of the town, but also allows visitors to experience the cultural atmosphere of the Kun Opera. Light is projected on white walls naturally, creating a traditional Chinese painting. The warm color temperature lighting highlights the beautiful texture of the wooden building, while emphasizing the extravagant composition of the skyline. Lighting with a variety of colors is used to graze and highlight the stone, wood, bricks of bridges, embankments, pavilions, and pagoda on multiple levels to express the night of the old street with a more dramatic Kun Opera scene.

gou-shan-li.description:
Gou Shan Li is a commercial complex with 22 unique historic villas. Located near the famous West Lake in Hangzhou city, it exhibits cultural features of the southern Yangtze River area in the context of historic Hangzhou city.

After careful analysis of the historic building structures and surrounding environment, ATL consultants created “Enjoy the Moon Shadow” as the theme of the landscape lighting.  Although the complex is now the headquarters for finance and business, ATL consultants simulated the natural moonlight effect with artificial lights to keep the atmosphere of the picturesque historic residences. Soft natural halos created by LED lamps are used to highlight building facades. Meanwhile, the lighting is projected to achieve the effect of “invisible fixture but visible light”, bringing out an elegant and beautiful environment for the historic Gou Shan Li.

gui-zhong-resort.description:
Gui Zong Resort is located at the foothills of Lushan Mountain, a famous scenic hot spring spot in Jiangxi Province.

Considering the dark surroundings, architectural lighting focused on creating a safe, warm and comfortable environment. LED strips were hidden under the façade, illuminating the eaves so that the perimeter of the building is lit by the reflection of light.  A warm and serene atmosphere was created through bamboo lanterns hung around the building, as well as lights on the lawn, garden and trees.

jinling-town.description: Located in Nanjing, China, as the initial phase of Jinling Town, Yan Ji Li is a tourist attraction that reproduces the cultural and architectural legacies of ancient China. The theme park contains Six-Dynasties-style buildings, which include a museum, a hotel, a traditional street market, gardens, creeks, and ponds. The interior and exterior of the buildings, the day and night scenes of the streets, and the landscapes are creatively designed to immerse visitors in the rich culture and elegant lifestyle of the Six Dynasties.

lingshan-town-specchar-nianhua-bay.description:
Lingshan Town · Nianhua Bay locates on the shore of Taihu Lake in Wuxi, China. It is a world-class Zen culture resort. Covering about 100 hectares, the resort integrates commercial district, ecological wetland, vacation residential area, conference center, and a boutique hotel. It aims to promote green lifestyle with the wisdom of oriental Zen culture.

Respecting architecture and landscape design concepts, ATL consultants focused on the richness of “Zen”, emphasizing the unique poetic mood of “Zen Life” in harmony with nature, with “hidden, soft, simple, beautiful and concise”. Lighting performance is the main starting point to create a new landmark for the revitalization of traditional culture.

The commercial streets convey a cheerful and pleasant environment, with the lighting based on 2700K warm light color, and the multi-level lighting forms a freehand effect. The lighting is mainly transmitted through the interior, supplemented by signboards, lanterns, underground lamps, and direction lights. Forming a commercial atmosphere, the lighting not only creates a beautiful nightscape but also attracts visitors lingering in the streets. The floodlighting luminaires are hidden to the utmost extent, resulting in the effect of “invisible fixture but visible light”. The position of every lantern is carefully considered, and the Zen effect of the light is formed as “one light one scene”. The ambience light is fully considered in landscape lighting planning. While providing normal basic lighting, the entire space environment is also concerned in landscape lighting, a lantern is part of the landscape, part of the building, and part of the space environment.

The Lighting design of Lingshan Town · Nianhua Bay won the 2nd prize of Shanghai Magnolia Lighting Design Award 2018, and the 3rd prize of AALD Lighting Design 2016.

yuan-jia-village.description:
The Tong Meng Town (also known historically as Yuan Jia Village) project was part of an important construction project in Henan province in 2017. The project covers an area of 400,000 square meters. It is created to be the first holiday resort in China’s central plain, with the theme “Revitalize the old Yuan Jia Village – eat, play, shop and stay well”. The core of the resort is a village style main street, creating and demonstrating the evolving local culture and custom dating back to the Ming and Qing Dynasties (AD1386 – 1912).  It is also created to be a showcase for ecological and green living style. 

 ATL consultants designed the village nightscape lighting scheme based on local, rural, and natural elements. The lighting was designed to highlight the buildings and maintain a natural village atmosphere, without needing to use new lighting technologies that are commonly used in city and landscape lighting. To maintain the rustic touch of the buildings, the appearance and shape of lighting fixtures are purposely processed with old treatment. With warm color LED inside, these functional and old-style LED fixtures create a more comfortable and nostalgic night atmosphere.

jiangning-citizen-center.description:
The Jiangning Citizen Center project was divided into two areas: Civil Affairs and Civil Culture, connected by the Civil Hall. The Center provides a one-stop service for the citizens in the Jiangning district of Nanjing City. It includes spaces for centers for women, children, and youth activities, a citizen’s lecture hall, conference centers, a theatre, a university for the elderly, and a government affairs center.

High efficient, energy-saving, uniform and brightness was the main consideration of lighting design for public areas, offices and meeting rooms. 4000K light color was chosen for these areas.  The theater and other performance exhibition spaces were mainly based on 3000K light color, creating a more artistic atmosphere. RGBW changeable color strips and LED projection lamps were used in the theatre to allow for different performance needs and to create a dynamic atmosphere.           

A centralized lighting control system was used to maximize the Lighting Power Density (LPD) value and energy-saving of the public building. The project’s goal was to be an environmentally-friendly citizen center which promoted healthy lifestyles. The Center has become a showcase for green and ecological concepts, and is certified as a three stars Green Building in China.

junkang-spring-experience-centre.description: Junkang Spring is a large, multi-functional “Continuing Care Retirement Community” (CCRC). The experience center of Junkang Spring was built to encourage their customers to explore the community’s excellent facilities and personalized professional services, and to connect customers to the brand. The cultural life area is on the first floor, displaying cultural activities offered in the community that vary from energetic to peaceful, from the material to the spiritual. In addition to the functional experience areas, the professional physiotherapy area on the second floor also has an indoor Chinese garden. The lighting design of the experience center is different from conventional commercial displays. The visual and psychological factors of the elderly are addressed in the design to create a more comfortable and healthy lighting environment.

k2-pomegranate-club.description:
The Pomegranate Club acts as the internal reception function of K2 Group in Beijing. The interior design combined the corporate culture and spirit of contemporary business with unique eastern landscape artistry. The overall decorative style is mainly traditional Chinese.

The lighting design of the Pomegranate Club is different from the typical commercial clubhouse. After learning and discussing the elements of interior design, ATL consultants worked to maximize the effect of the interior space. The overall space used a 3000K warm white light. In addition to the low glare and high color rendering down lights in the Chinese style ceiling light trough, double rows of LED T5 hard strips were designed to provide a more comfortable light diffusing.

Considering the different functional space requirements of the club, ATL lighting consultants focused their attention on creating a sense of rhythm within the space. They aimed to create a quiet, comfortable and elegant space that was also convenient for the owners to operate and manage.

nishan-auditorium.description:
Next to the Confucian Palace, the Nishan Auditorium is in the Nishan Holy Land Scenic Area of Qufu City, Shandong Province. The project，with a total construction area of 32,000 square meters, faces the holy lake of Mount Nishan and backs against Mount Nishan. It has an excellent natural scenery and deep history. It is a cultural tourism venue, including conferences, banquets, events, exhibitions, and other functions. After the grand opening, Nishan Auditorium will become the permanent site of the Nishan World Civilization Forum.

The Nishan Auditorium is designed with the traditional decoration style of the Confucian Palace, incorporating many traditional Chinese architectural elements such as columns, buckets, and grilles. Its scale is truly remarkable. In addition to fulfilling the functional requirement, the lighting is required to meet the national conference space and the video broadcast standards. The main hall can accommodate 1,820 guests. To ensure the flow of the enormous number of guests, the top surface adopts a variety of lighting forms such as luminous film, hidden wall washer, and top-emitting chandeliers, while the ground and wall lighting is mainly based on functional downlights. The light environment of the entire space is diversified and consistent with the decorative style.

shanghai-land-group-headquarters-office.description:
The sales headquarters of Shanghai Real Estate Group is located in the Hongqiao Financial Center Building. The interior design style is bright and simplistic.        

Considering that the office building has a nice view with good natural light, ATL consultants selected the efficient T5 DALI intelligent dimming system with daylight sensors to form a bright, efficient and energy-saving office lighting environment. A dynamic illumination system was specially designed for the reception area. The light color temperature is easily changed from 2700K to 5600K to create an environment that adapted to the rhythm of the human biological clock, changing slowly throughout the day.

The lighting control system in the meeting room space could also control the curtains to set the scene for conference discussions or for presentations with projections. When the sensor detects no human activity, the conference room lights automatically shut off to save energy.

show-house-specchar-lingshan-zen-town.description:
The Showhouse is a beautiful, scenic building located in Lingshan Zen Town, Wuxi.  Bamboo, water, wood and stone were used to create a natural and comfortable Zen space. The lighting design created a relaxed space for the freedom of spiritual and cultural expression.

In the entrance area, an art piece made with natural bamboo joints was the foreground to a large Chinese ink landscape painting. The lighting design used the method of diffusing to brighten the background painting evenly. The bamboo art created a silhouette effect, creating a dreamlike Zen atmosphere.

On the second floor, the lighting design of the atrium rest area was soft and simple. A comfortable atmosphere was created through even track lights, which illuminated the top portion of the walls. Two rows of customized lighting fixtures were embedded at the bottom of some bamboo joints to supplement the accent lighting.

wutong-family-sales-center-and-showroom.description:
Wutong family is the first community service center for seniors developed by the China Taiping Insurance Group. It is built for the high-end pensioner market. The community is in Shanghai Zhoupu International Medical Park, with a construction area of 290,000 square meters and an estimated investment of CNY 3 billion (Appx. USD 428M). 

The interior design of the sales center was simple and comfortable. The warm white lighting created a bright and relaxing atmosphere. A suspended sky-light box was used to illuminate the display area with natural light. The lighting design of the meeting area combined both direct and indirect illumination, providing a more private atmosphere.           

The model house displays different activities of seniors’ daily life. In addition to the display function, the lighting design considered special accommodations required by the occupants. Due to challenges with vision and cognition, it is essential that the spaces are well lit and have uniformity of light dispersed throughout the space. The space is dominated by 3000K/4000K neutral light, creating a bright and comfortable home environment. In the model balconies and windows, 6500K high-color temperature ceiling lamps are used to simulate outdoor visual effects in an indoor closed space.

boromedo-hotel.description:
Boromedo Hotel and International Conference Center is in the Zen town of Lingshan, Wuxi. It is a recreational resort hotel with a Buddhist and Zen culture theme.  It is also the permanent site to host the World Buddhist Forum. The hotel has more than 400 guest rooms and 13 conference rooms. The largest banquet hall is 1,500 square meters, which can accommodate nearly 1,000 people.

The interior design theme contains three key elements: Flower, Smile, and Bay. In the public spaces, the guest rooms and the conference center, natural elements, such as mountains and clouds, ran through the outline of the interior decorative components. Ancient elements such as cloud panels, bamboo knots and square lanterns were worked into lighting fixtures and furniture.           

Lighting was carefully designed for every space. All of the lighting fixtures were equipped with high efficiency, energy saving and low glare LEDs. The color rendering of the LED light source was more than 90, providing a high-quality lighting environment. The design not only enhanced visual comfort but also highlighted the artistic expression of the space and created a comfortable Zen atmosphere for every visitor.

The hotel lobby, public corridors, elevator halls, and other public spaces used an intelligent lighting dimming control system that can be programmed to adapt to the changing natural environment.  This system met many different functional needs, while maximizing energy saving.

club-house-of-green-wave-gallery.description:
The Green Wave Gallery in Shanghai Old Town is a restaurant famous for hosting state banquet receptions. In addition to the cuisine, guests are attracted to the restaurant due to the interior design and dining experience.

In order to upgrade the interior environment, Green Wave Gallery designated Club 7, a 400 square meter two-story building as fine dining space. Without changing the original layout and form of space, the interior renovation added silk screens and throw pillows with a soft and light color scheme.

To create a bright and comfortable environment for fine dining experience, energy-saving, efficient LED lamps were installed.  While the original decorative pendant lamps were remained, LED spotlights with a wider beam were added to illuminate the dishes and create an intimate atmosphere for the patrons.

fangxia-hotel.description:
Located in the renowned tourist town, Nianhuawan in Wuxi, China, Fangxia is a boutique hotel with a motif of healthy sleep and lifestyle change courses in the context of Zen culture.

In Zen, Fangxia means relinquishing one’s mundane desires and finding their true self. The architectural environment of the Fangxia hotel inspires guests to relax their minds and bodies and let go of their obsessions from the moment they step into the hotel.

The light emanated from the indoors and the landscape light presents a welcoming atmosphere at the building entrance. In the courtyard, light and shadow create a peaceful and relaxing space. The human centric and circadian lighting system mimics the natural daylight during the daytime and enables a personalized sleeping environment in every guestroom during the evening. The touch screen allows guests to customize the light color and the healing music to set up a meditation atmosphere in the room.

nianhua-bay-guesthouses.description:
There are twenty-five different themed guesthouses in Nian Hua Bay. Each guesthouse had a unique Zen theme expressing varying regional and architectural characteristics.         

The overall lighting design for these rooms was to create a bright, cozy, and comfortable atmosphere. A variety of lighting forms and installation methods were used to complement each of the different interior design theme elements. In the hallways, dining room and other public spaces, functional lighting was the primary consideration, giving guests a warm homey feel. Based on the different architectural layouts, sub-loop and centralized lighting control systems were used to manage the public corridors. These systems could control both the semi-outdoor and the fully enclosed indoor corridor space, maximizing the usage of natural light, saving on operation costs, and offering ease of maintenance.          

The overall lighting design of the guesthouses created a comfortable atmosphere through efficient lamp layout design, classic lamp selection and convenient operation and management.

nishan-binshe-hotel.description:
Nishan Binshe Hotel is located in Qufu, Shandong, the birthplace of Confucius. The construction area of the hotel is 45,000 sqm, and includes more than 300 guest rooms, and other various facilities, such as restaurants, function rooms, banquet halls, a swimming pool, etc. It is a building compound for collective functions of accommodation, dining, conference, exhibition, cultural experience, and tourism.

Surrounded by scenic lake and mountains in the Nishan Holy Land resort, the hotel interior is designed on the theme of “Farming-reading Culture”. A leisurely and quiet atmosphere is created by multi-level indirect lighting. The decorative materials and artworks are highlighted by accent lighting. Lighting accomplishes both functional requirements and decorative features.

walnew-house.description:
Walnew House consists of a restaurant, a lounge, and some independent small meeting rooms. The design integrated elements of art and elegance to create a relaxed atmosphere.

ATL consultants adopted an intelligent lighting system for decorative and artistic effect. Functional applications were managed from one control panel.  Each space had unique art chandeliers and wall lamps to create a fascinating interplay of lights and shadows. A series of spotlights were used to illuminate the light-colored shells on stainless steel cables in a hallway with mirrors on both sides, creating the illusion of an infinite space.

yunshu-therapy-house.description: The Yunshu therapy house is a two-story building for Zen recuperation and therapy courses. In the foyer, multilayered indirect lighting guides guests into a quiet and warm Zen world. The tearoom in the reception area is designed with a relaxing and comfortable lighting environment with minimized luminaire quantity. The meditation room is completely enclosed without any natural light. Consequently, a DMX-controlled RGBW lighting system sets up an immersive tranquil and gentle atmosphere. As requested by the therapists, the system enables them to guide meditation in a changing lighting environment, from soft white to dark warm red to bright white light.  The sound therapy room is on the basement floor. Natural light from the lightwell is integrated with indirect artificial light to create a variety of lighting modes based on the needs of the sound therapy course. With a pyramidal ceiling, the spacious yoga room hosts many group yoga activities. An artificial skylight illuminates the surroundings of the ceiling and diffuses circadian lighting to the whole yoga room.
